summary: This bill, the "America's Olympic and Paralympic Games Commemorative Coins Act," mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins for the 2028 Olympic and Paralympic Games in Los Angeles and the 2034 Winter Olympics and Paralympics in Salt Lake City. It specifies coin denominations, designs, mintage limits, sale prices, and surcharges. Surcharges generated from the 2028 coins will go to the United States Olympic and Paralympic Properties. Surcharges from the 2034 coins will go to the Organizing Committee for the 2034 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games. The bill aims to increase awareness of the Games and provide financial support for their execution and legacy programs.
